moves.1... Nf6: I chose nf6 in order to achieve something like Groundfeld defense.
moves.2... g6: KID or Grundfell defense, I am not really sure what to do.
moves.4. cxd5: Taking one of my center pawns.
moves.4... Qxd5: If nc3 then qa5, I am alright.
moves.5... Bg4: Trying to give white doubled pawns.
moves.7. Qxf3: In the mean time, I don't mind a centered knight.
moves.8. Nc3: Forcing my queen to do something.
moves.8... Qxf3 9. gxf3: I think I am all right here.
moves.10... e6: Since there is no hope in the center, let's attack on the flanks.
moves.11... Bb4: Trying to kill that center guardian.
moves.13... Nd5: The knight is been defended only once.
moves.16. O-O-O: Castling king-side in the middle of the storm.
moves.17. cxd4 Rc8+: The first check of the game.
moves.18. Kb2 Nd7b6: Getting ready to assault the white king.
moves.19... Nc4+: Let's get rid of one of those bishops.
moves.21... Rc3+ 22. Kb2 Rxf3: Just activate the other rook and white is falling.
moves.24. Bg2: Mouse slip? Not in a 3 days per move game, just blindness or stupid sacrifice.
moves.24... Nxg2 25. Rb1: I won't allow a passed pawn for white.
moves.25... b5 26. axb5 axb5 27. Rxb5 O-O: If I don't castle now I lose my h8 rook.
moves.28. Rb4: Defending a pawn which is not attacked :S.
moves.29... Nxh4 30. Ke2 Rfc3: The rooks are connected, I own the c file.
moves.31. f4 Nf5: Capitalizing on those loose pawns, the white king is restricted.
moves.32. Rdb2: I have the c and he the b file, still, let's keep adding pressure.
moves.39. Kd4 f6: Game over, he finally realizes that his chances doesn't exist.
